original:
The painter commenced the process by preparing a sheet of paper with a red-orange chalk background. He began by outlining the shapes using charcoal or black stone, followed by the application of a gray chalk background. To achieve a blurring effect, he rubbed the charcoal and black stone, creating a sfumato effect in the intermediate shadows. This modeling technique was further enhanced with a gray wash to deepen the shadows. 

The arti

To achieve a blurring effect, he rubbed the charcoal and black stone, creating a sfumato effect in the intermediate shadows. This modeling technique was further enhanced with a gray wash to deepen those shadows.
